text: Hearing one has cancer, even a curable kind, takes one by surprise, to say the least. Once the mental adjustment is made, what follows is unexpected clarity of thought. Itâ€™s a time when youâ€¦ After my surgery tomorrow, I plan on working towards a full recovery in time to welcome my first grandchild into the world in August.
Take care Edna â€“ wishing you a speedy recovery.

I went through this a little less than a year ago. Everytime I look at the enormous scar that cuts my abdÃ´men down the middle, I think of at least one of the things you listed. Itâ€™s a beautiful reminder to me of how precious my life is. I wish you the best of luck and a peaceful recovery.
Ouch.  you take care of yourself and get well soon!BWJames
Thank you for having the courage to share your news. Know that we are all here, near and far, cheering you on as you beat this thing. Stay strong.
Good luck with the op.  Hope it all goes well! Make sure you get plenty of time to recharge your batteries!!
Our thoughts & prayers are with you Edna.Wishing you a speedy recovery,Dave
Ed, you find  the exact words to say things. .You pull out the heart and core of experiences.  I cant find words to say back but join with all your friends to wish you well.
Oh Edna, be well.Distressing news. Incredible attitude.Thinking of you.

Edna, I am so sorry to hear your news. I am halfway around the world, but had just come to visit your blog as I was commenting to a friend about how much I enjoy your insights â€“ so sorry to know you are dealing with hard news. I hope your treatment goes well, and know that people are wishing you all the best!
Kia kaha, Kia manawanui. Be strong and brave.

Blessings, blessings, blessings in the precise shape of YOUR need. You are thought of on every continent! Courage â€“ you do not walk this path alone . . . thereâ€™s an international community standing by your side . . .
Thinking of YOU and praying that all is going well and that YOU are not in pain or uncomfortable!!!! Bless YOU a thousand times!
Thinking of YOU and praying that all is going well and that YOU are not in pain or uncomfortable!!!! Bless YOU a thousand times!
Good luck, heal well.Gina
Your incredible mindfulness and courage will help carry you through Edna. Wishing you the very best of outcomes and- yes â€“ so many supporting you from near and far. Take care, Kath
Wishing you all the best, Edna! You certainly have a great attitude. ðŸ™‚Take care!Kath
Thinking of you. Keep positive and know you are supported from so manyâ€¦even those youâ€™ve only met online. Take care.

Edna I will be thinking of you tomorrow and only wish you a successful and speedy recovery. Looking forward to having you back at school stretching our thinking and encouraging us to question what learning is really about. Sending you much love. X Lana
You have been in my thoughts constantly since hearing the news and I am willing you well. Hails

I havenâ€™t been following blogs or Twitter much at all this past school year. Iâ€™ve actually just transferred to Feedly in the last couple of days to get caught up with my favorites, and this is the first of yours Iâ€™ve seen. Iâ€™m very sorry to hear about your having to go through this experience, but as usual, youâ€™ve found a way to see the positive in it. You will be in my prayers!
Take care of yourself and I will be praying for you. What a great motivation for a speedy recovery- a grandchild. Enjoy!
Best of luck!

Edna â€“ I will be thinking of you and hope your surgery is a success. May your recovery and road ahead be as smooth as it can be. Itâ€™s time to take your energetic and inspiring spirit and direct it towards yourself. Thank you for the constant inspiration and thought provoking writing you do. Take care!
Thinking of you tomorrow and wishing you a speedy recovery Edna!
Best wishes to you from a Canadian colleague!  I too have been where you are, and, through many prayers and lots of love, I am well.  Will be praying for a swift recovery! May God bless you.

Thinking of you.  I would highly recommend reading A Bend in the Road by Dr. David Jeremiah.  It is very helpful for anyone going through a trial. Very powerful! It has helped me get through a very difficult time in my life. I reread it at least twice a year.

Edna, your positivity and spirit will go a long way to aiding your recovery, which we all hope will be as smooth and as quick as possible. Youâ€™ll be in our thoughts constantly tomorrow and over the next few weeks. Looking forward to having you back on your feet, fighting fit, and to hearing all about the special arrival in August.
My thoughts and prayers are with you, Ed! Wishing you a speedy recovery. Big hug!
Praying for you, Edna, for a quick and complete recovery.  You will love being and grandmother!
A new grandchild! What hope and excitement!  You will be a terrific grandparent!  Best of wishes for the times ahead xxJJ @7mrsjames

Thinking of you and keeping you in my prayers! I have read every post from your blog for so long and learned so much from you.  Being a grandmother is the best!I hope that all goes well and that you are completely recovered very soon,Beth Diaz

Go well Edna, your list is so very true! Now it is time for you to set some time just for you. Time to heal, time to relax with family and friends. You have given us all so much through your incredible blogs. Now it is time for us to give you our best wishes and prays!
I did not know Edna but I am keeping you in my thoughts.  My prayers to you for a speedy recovery!
Hugging you through my iPad Edna! Rita Bouchard
Once again you used words to impart an important message with great skill and style.  Wishing you all the best .  Celia
Speedy recovery Edna, keep that grandchild in mind. Jenny Ashby

Edna, in the short time Iâ€™ve known you through Twitter and #pypchat, youâ€™ve been an inspiration to me and a source of teaching wisdom.  Have a speedy recovery and know that our hearts and prayers are with you.
Edna,Wishing you a speedy recovery. A new grandchild! ðŸ™‚Best wishes!Nina
Best wishes on a swift recovery from Shanghai.Ian
Edna, Im sure your recovery will be quick. Ive known you for about 2 years now and you always inspire me (and so many others) through your posts, emails, tweets. See you in July for that coffee!
All the best for a speedy recovery Ed x
Edna,Sending the most positive of wishes to you â€”
Global connectedness even through ill health.  America wishes you well.
Hoping all goes well for you!  Thanks for an important reminder ðŸ™‚
Thoughts and prayers are with you Edna.
My prayers are with you.  I do not usually comment on your blog, but I enjoy following it.  Thank you!
Sincerest good wishes for a speedy and fulsome recovery Edna.
Take care, friend ðŸ™‚
Take care and wish you a speedy recovery.
Beautifully said. Take care.
Edna, my thoughts and prayers are with you. I hope you take the time to rest and recover well. Congrats on being a grandma very soon!
Take care and I wish for a speedy recovery!
Hope all went well today Edna. Looking forward to welcoming you into the grandparent club ðŸ™‚ Itâ€™s a great club to belong to! Take care.- thinking of you and sending yu lots of good wishes.
Be well Edna.
Your strength is admirable; your words inspiring.  All the best.
Wishing you a speedy recovery Edna! Be blessed!
Thinking of you and wishing you a speedy recovery.  This experience will lead you to learning more about yourself and and others.  Every cloud has a silver lining!

Iâ€™ve always thought that itâ€™s a shame that it takes a life threatening event to get us to slow down and be thankful and see what is truly important in life. As shocking as this may seem now, it is a positive event. Having cancer is never easy, even if itâ€™s the curable kind, however looking back on my dealings with cancer, I see it as a positive event in my life because it made me see life clearly. If only everyone could have the â€˜experienceâ€™ without having to deal with cancer or anything life threatening. You will be in my prayers Edna as you deal with this dreadful disease. Iâ€™m a survivor and you will be too!

Thinking of you, Edna and how grateful I am for your generosity, mindfulness and curiosity. Your blog has provoked and encouraged me to reflect, develop and change my teaching and my thinking. You are an inspiration. I hope and pray that the operation has gone smoothly and that you have a peaceful recovery.
You are such an inspiration to me. I wish you well after your op. Take care.
All the best Edna,am a first year teacher and have been enjoying your inspiring blogs.

Dear Edna, I am sorry to hear of this challenge in your life. LIke Selena, I also pray that your operation has gone smoothly and that your recovery will be swift and complete. You are an inspiring person. Congratulations on becoming a grandmama as well. Do take care.
Sorry I jumped the gun on grandmotherhood there, but well, best wishes to you and all your family for the expected new arrival.

Hi Edna, so sorry to hear your news. Cancer is never a pleasant word and I can only imagine some of the feelings you must have. Hope you have come through the surgery okay and that you will be in full health to enjoy the birth of your grandchildren. Grandchildren are so, so special and this baby will be so lucky to have you as a Grandma! Take care!
Thinking of you â€“ hope to see you well and blogging soon. Meredith
Sending you lots of prayer and good wishes. Hoping you find overwhelming amounts of grace and peace in this season!
Thank you for all the support and encouragement from around the world ðŸ™‚ Iâ€™m well on the road to recovery!
Edna, Keep positive!  You are a strong determined woman.
much love dear.

Hi Edna-on Feb. 25 I had surgery for prostate cancer and during the first few weeks of my recovery I was overcome with adjustments and challenges. The biggest adjustment for me was to slow down and take the time I needed to recover . . . this I found difficult! Once I allowed myself to do this, after about 4 weeks from the date of my surgery many things became very clear to me. Many of them you mentioned in your blog entry. Thanks for sharing and I am still recovering but totally excited about the prospect of another school year.I trust you are well.Don WielingaTwitter: @Wielinga1
